column4: RPT-Investor who mesmerized Musk on conference call opened "Pandora's box"
column5: May 3 A 25-year-old investor of Tesla Inc   whose 23-minute conversation with Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk dominated a post-earnings conference call  said he had opened "Pandora's box" and elevated the level of conversation possible on the routine calls.

column4: Hedge fund heaps criticism on Tesla after Musk's conference call
column5: NEW YORK A small hedge fund manager who has long been betting against Tesla Inc  on Thursday redoubled his call for the stock to fall to zero  comments that came as investors were already hammering the electric car maker.

column4: Hedge fund heaps criticism on Tesla after Musk's conference call
column5: NEW YORK  May 3 A small hedge fund manager who has long been betting against Tesla Inc on Thursday redoubled his call for the stock to fall to zero  comments that came as investors were already hammering the electric car maker.

column4: Musk's conduct  Tesla stock slide make $700 million profit for short-sellers
column5: NEW YORK Short-sellers who had targeted Tesla Inc  logged a $700 million paper profit on Thursday after the stock fell nearly 9 percent a day after Chief Executive Elon Musk stunned analysts by dodging "boring" questions about the electric car maker's financial outlook. | Video

column4: UPDATE 1-Musk's conduct  Tesla stock slide make $700 mln profit for short-sellers
column5: NEW YORK  May 3 Short-sellers who had targeted Tesla Inc logged a $700 million paper profit on Thursday after the stock fell nearly 9 percent a day after Chief Executive Elon Musk stunned analysts by dodging "boring" questions about the electric car maker's financial outlook.

column4: New VW CEO vows integrity drive but investors unimpressed
column5: BERLIN Volkswagen's  new chief executive on Thursday vowed to make the carmaker "more honest" as it fights to recover from 2015's diesel emissions scandal  but its wary investors called for outside vetting of steps to restore its reputation.

column4: UPDATE 2-New VW CEO vows integrity drive but investors unimpressed
column5: * Investors demand independent scrutiny of corp culture (Releads on culture change comments  adds investor comments and detail on battery purchasing)

column4: The price of Musk cutting off analysts? For Tesla  it's $2 billion
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Ducking analysts' questions has a price: $2 billion. | Video

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 5-The price of Musk cutting off analysts? For Tesla  it's $2 bln
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  May 2 Ducking analysts' questions has a price: $2 billion.

column4: German car registrations up 8 percent in April on SUV sales: KBA
column5: FRANKFURT Passenger car registrations in Germany rose 8 percent in April from the same month last year to 314 055 cars  boosted by a surge in demand for sport-utility vehicles (SUVs) and luxury cars  the country's KBA vehicle authority said on Thursday.
